title: Lowe’s Stock Is the Best Way to Play a Resurgent Home-Improvement Sector, Analyst Says
text:
Lowe’s stock is rising on Tuesday, helped by an upgrade from Piper Jaffray, which argues that the home-improvement retailer can beat modest Wall Street expectations as demand strengthens into 2020.

The back story. Lowe’s shares (ticker: LOW) have climbed 21.6% in 2019, compared with an 19.6% climb for the S&P 500. Lowe’s rally began last year, as investors cheered new leadership and store closures that many believed were long overdue. While the trade war is still an overhang, robust earnings and insider purchases have...
description: Piper Jaffray’s Peter Keith boosted his rating on the shares to Overweight from Neutral and raised his price target to $130 from $113.
